Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior glazed (fired red); exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Possibly, but not likely, context Φ4(?) (?)
Curator's comments: Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis (Williams 1983, 169). Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983 The number 4 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. Possibly a context number (Context Φ4?), but more likely from a series of Chian chalices.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1670) (phase 2)
